snippet: For the nation’s biggest supermarket chain, the cost of consolidating in union workers’ pension plans offset an increase in sales.
abstract: Kroger Co reports a fourth-quarter loss as a result of pension costs, despite higher sales; loss was $306.9 million, or 54 cents a share, compared with profit of $278.8 million, or 44 cents a share, in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: For the nation’s biggest supermarket chain, the cost of consolidating in union workers’ pension plans offset an increase in sales.

headline.seo: Kroger Says Pension Costs Led to Loss in Quarter
headline.main: Kroger Says Pension Costs Led to Loss in Quarter
headline.print_headline: Kroger Says Pension Costs Led to Loss In Quarter
